messages.page_content:
- Topic: Waiver of Building and Demolition Permit Fees for Hurricane Ida Damage
- Summary: The ordinance aims to waive certain fees for building permits and demolition permits required to repair or rebuild structures damaged by Hurricane Ida, with the exception of ongoing renovations or new construction. The purpose is to facilitate the recovery process for affected properties.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,459
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion to Suspend the Rules to receive Motion No. M-21-381 - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Motion to Suspend the Rules to add Motion No. M-21-381 - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 3: Adoption of the ordinance - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the waiver of certain fees for building and demolition permits related to Hurricane Ida damage.
- Tags/Keywords: Building permits, Demolition permits, Hurricane Ida, Fee waiver
- UID: 11cc8005-5636-467f-b18d-0e8c99b5f20c

- Topic: Amendment to Inspector General Appointment Timeframe
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to reduce the time from four to two years when a former or current official or employee of New Orleans city government, the state, or its political subdivisions may be appointed to inspector general. It also allowed for certain employees of the office of inspector general of the state or its political subdivisions to be immediately eligible for appointment to inspector general.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,448
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any opposing votes.
- UID: 77d82bcd-cf89-46b7-a84e-53ba1c6cf5cc

- Topic: Creation of "Convenience Centers" and Waste/Recycling Drop-off Centers
- Summary: The motion directed the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create a new use category of "convenience centers" or "waste and recycling drop-off centers." It also sought to establish site design and use standards and make recommendations for any other necessary amendments.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-364
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed with six supporting votes and one council member absent.
- UID: 77d82bcd-cf89-46b7-a84e-53ba1c6cf5cc

- Topic: Ordinance for Lease with IX ACP Hotel Owner, LP
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to execute a lease with IX ACP Hotel Owner, LP for a property in the Second District of New Orleans for a period of forty years and eleven months, with an annual rental of $215,000. The rental amount will be increased every five years to the Market Rate determined by an appraisal. 
- Ordinance Number: 33490
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a unanimous vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease, Property, New Orleans, Rental, Market Rate
- UID: 559d16b6-2c72-4928-af58-0bb481d9d0ff

- Topic: Ordinance for Lease with New Hotel Monteleone, LLC
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to execute a lease with New Hotel Monteleone, LLC for airspace above Exchange Alley, Royal Street, and Iberville Street for a period of twenty years, with yearly rental of $12,528. The rental amount will increase by 10% every five years during the primary term, and by appraisal for each renewal option term.
- Ordinance Number: 33491
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a unanimous vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease, New Orleans, Airspace, Rental, Renewal Options
